Atlanta, Georgia Liller, Neal, Battle & Lindsey, Inc,
STEP program (Summer Time Employment Program) produced over-quota job
offers. Activity' now: recruiting youth to fill the jobs. Good newspaper
publicity, public service (weekly newspaper) advertising, radio and TV spots
Particularly effective: script developed for telephone solicitation of small
business firms.
Memphis, Tenn. Greenhaw & Rush, Inc.
"Take the High Road" full-page newspaper advertisement spelled out
the area educational opportunities for high school graduates who weren’t
going to college. Nearly 5,000 young people attended Memphis Job Fair.
Good media support for all phases of program. Community cooperation:
20 miniparks built in 21 days — 26 miniparks cleared in all.
Milwaukee, Wis. Klau-Van Pietersom-Dunlap, Inc.
Major advertising and Public Relations firms recruited for long-range,
continuing activity. Communications Coordinator sent 25 kits of advertising
material to businessmen asking them to pick the advertisements they wanted
to sponsor. Milwaukee theme: Summer Action '68. Fifteen outdoor locations
obtained for "Give Jobs - Give Hope - Give A Damn" postings. Bus cards and
pounter cards carry same theme. Tabloid newspaper on all opportunities for
youth to be published bi-weekly through the summer... staffed by inner-city
youth. Extensive coverage of major press conference on JOBS.
